info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 9:29AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Catawba, southeastern McDowell, Rutherford, eastern Polk, western Lincoln, Cleveland, southern Burke, northeastern Greenville, northern Spartanburg and northwestern Cherokee Counties through 1000 AM EDT... At 929 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles northwest of Shelby to 6 miles southwest of Rutherfordton to 11 miles south of Columbus. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Shelby, Newton, Forest City, Rutherfordton, Boiling Springs SC, Spindale, Boiling Springs NC, Landrum, Cowpens and Inman. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
